intro: Crawfurdia gracilipes, commonly known as the slender-stemmed crawfurdia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and related species. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and opposite, ovate leaves. Its flowers are typically small, clustered in umbels, and feature a distinctive corolla with five lobes. Crawfurdia gracilipes is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
